All Reviews

  1. This is the best BB cream I've ever used, hands down, and I've tried close to 20, mostly Asian but some European and American brands too. This feels like a \\"second skin\\" and it oxidizes to perfectly match, blend, and \\"brighten\\" my skin tone. With other foundations and BB creams I always felt like I was wearing something, but this just melds with my skin. I cannot think of one thing to complain about. I love the packaging even!
  2. I had purchased sample bb creams before to choose the right bb cream for me, when i got this i saw that it was a small size but still i was happy to have received it, for some reason the consistency was not the same as i had remembered but it was still ok, it was a bit runny, and left me looking a bit too dewy but it was somewhat the same as other bb creams i had tried. Will keep on looking for other products but will maybe purchase this in the near future.
  3. Great coverage, doesn't feel oily. Will keep purchasing over and over again. I am now using this instead of traditional foundation!
  4. American cosmetics companies have gotten into the BB cream business lately, but the ones I've tried from Garnier and L'Oreal are just basically tinted moisturizer. But this cream is thick, and unlike American products has a greyish tint to it. That sounds awful, I know, but I have pale skin, freckles and some red splotchiness around my nose and chin when I get out of the shower, and this smoothes everything over and looks great after it's absorbed. I used to moisturize and then add foundation and powder, now I just use this right out of the shower, no makeup sponge necessary, and brush a little powder on top. And compared to department-store foundations this is a teriffic bargain.
  5. Few months ago, after all the hype about BB creams, I bought Missha Perfect BB Cream #23, Etude House Precious Mineral BB Cream #13, and Skin 79 pink label BB Cream (Ebay seller in Korea). Also bought Smash Box BB cream and tried many other American brands BB creams (Dior, Boscia, Too Face, Tarte). I have combination, normal to oil skin, thus, make-up only lasts about 4 hours, even though I work indoor (I am a once-a-day make-up kindda girl). B/c of popularity of Missha, I used it first. Some reasons, I felt it was too heavy, too oily. Then I switched to Skin 79 and Etude House. They all go on every smooth and easy to blend (I use stippling brush). Skin 79 pink label only comes in 1 color and it's sheer/light coverage. It's even out my skin but it does not cover capillary red spots or black spots due to acnes. It lasts 4-5 hours. Etude House Precious Mineral #13 is a bit light for me. It is medium coverage. However, I found that it's a bit dry. It makes me flaky around the nose area. I decided to use Etude House as concealer. Not the best but it works. It also works when I mix Skin 79 and Etude House together. Neither one of these products have any fragant to it. Missha BB cream does have fragrant. It smells like baby powder-ish. It's not bad (it eventually goes away after after few hours); however, I really don't care for the smell. Some people actually like the fragrant (on youtube). That was also one other reason I stopped using Missha. After months, I decided to \\"re-visit\\" Missha BB cream again. Still don't care for the fragrant; however, it gives a medium coverage. My skin is very clear except for the capillary red spots around the nose and occasional black acne spots. So I don't really need a \\"heavy\\" coverage (I used Laura Bare Mineral and Mercier tinted moisturizure for a long time). However, with a bit of setting powder, Missha BB cream lasts almost all day. Plus of Missha BB cream, high SPF (maybe that why it seems more oily).<br />In summary, for medium coverage Missha (if you don't mind the fragrant), Etude House (if you don't have dry skin). For light coverage, Skin 79. Tips: even though, BB creams are all in one products, always wear moisturizures (=/- additional sun block) and setting powder. Even though, you can build for more coverage, but I'd not recommended b/c it will look very heavy. Also, buy from a reputable Ebay sellers. It is cheaper than amazon, around $11-13. Beware, fake products are out there (I do not understand this either b/c it's not every expensive, why do people make/sell fake products). I suspect that these products are \\"drug-store\\" brands in Korea. But since we can't get our hands on, we are paying a bit more. Next, I want to try Tony Molly CC cream.<br />As for American brands, Smash Box is heavy, almost like foundation. Dior BB creams are more of yellow tone and dark. Tarte is too powdery for my liking. Boscia is water base so it's nice; however, it's one shade and not recommended for darker than NC-35. Too Face gives a dewy/sheer/natural look and good for yellow tone skin.<br />Hope you will find a right products.
  6. Love it. I have oily skin and this bb cream does not make it more oily, it covers great an feels great on skin.
  7. This is FAKE and gave me awful breakout!!! The first day using it was fine, actually good coverage, but starting from the second day breakout came!
  8. I went through this brand of BB cream fast. Super fast. It only took me about two months to go through it all, and I was widely dismayed, no wonder it was so cheap. It also does not have the extent of coverage that Face Shop brands have, so I was forced to use more of it. I was not impressed. Do yourself a favor and spend your money instead on Face Shop BB Cream: http://www.amazon.com/THE-FACE-SHOP-Magic-Natural/dp/B0054U56GO/. This one's lasted me almost a year and still going strong, full, weightless coverage, and you use less of it.
  9. My complexion isn't really that light or dark for a Mexican, but the cream blends in really nicely and gets rid of the small blemishes I have from sun exposure, acne, etc. The best thing about is that it makes my skin look really smooth and natural since the cream is really light so it's actually like, the perfect product for me since I don't like wearing makeup anyways (the most I use is some mascara and a small thin layer of eyeliner.)<br /><br />So if you're looking for something to just smooth/even out your face, this shit's the way to go.
  10. I have tried a few BB creams but certainly not all. This one is on the thicker side so it provides a bit more coverage than some. I wish they had more colors. I found this to be on the gray side, almost ashy in color.
  11. This cream is exactly what I have always needed for my skin, and at 27 years old, I have finally found it. My skin is very fair/light and acne prone. My skintone is a little uneven and is combination. I use almost one full pump of BB cream on my face to start with, and it does an amazing job of evening my skintone out and giving it a nice, dewy glow. Then, I use some concealer under my eyes and finish up with MAC loose powder in light. I can tell a huge difference in my face, my acne has greatly improved and my makeup has never looked better. I highly recommend this product, I have tried dozens of low-end and high-end creams, powders, treatments, masks, foundations, mousse, you name it, and this BB cream is the best thing that has ever happened to my face!
  12. I bought the MIssha brand a while ago and loved it. I have had freckles my whole life and a very uneven skin tone. I read the reviews on the skin 79 and thought it was a step above the Missha.   14. I work outdoors, and I like simplicity, so I was looking for a single face product that has good spf, decent coverage, and would not wear off from sweat or rain. I also have stupidly sensitive skin, so harsh perfumes and other chemicals are a no-go. Tall order! I heard about BB creams, and was willing to risk a breakout or rash to find a great product. I had an amazon gift card, and used part of it on a mini set of Skin 79. The &#34;hot pink&#34; was my favorite out of that bunch. The first day I wore it, I went to spinning class - I thought it was a perfect test for the durability and sweat-proof-ness. 75 minutes later, I am astonished to say that this product (mostly) stayed put!!! Wha?!? I thought, &#34;Since it lasted through spin, it must be excessively harsh, so I will be breaking out any minute now.&#34; Well, that never happened either. There must be some catch, but I haven't found it yet. I only gave it 4 stars because it does dry out my skin if I wear it multiple days in a row (which I rarely do). I am soooo happy that I have found this product!

  17. I love this BB cream and wear it just about every day. I've tried samples of American BB creams from Sephora, and this one is better than all of them. It looks a little yellow or grayish right out of the bottle, but once I rub it in it blends in perfectly with my alabaster skin tone. It evens out any redness and makes it look like I have perfect skin without makeup. It gives me a slightly dewy look, and I brush on a little Bare Minerals powder if I want a matte finish.<br /><br />The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is that the pump container means you have know idea how much product is left. One day I pump it and it's fine, the next day it's out. There's no way to remove the top and scrape out the remaining BB cream. If it were in a tube or jar I could tell how much was left and also be sure I got every last bit out of it.
  18. This cream has a light coverage but evens my skin tone and does not irritate or make my sensitive skin break out :)
  19. I love everything about this product... except that I'm allergic to it! It goes on very nourishing and moisturizing at first, gives great coverage, and blends easily to match my pale skin. It looks flawless. However, after using this product every day for 1 week, I noticed that after a few hours, my skin started feeling very tight. By the end of the day, my forehead was flaking. I use moisturizer before applying this product though. In fact, I have not changed anything about my skin care routine except for adding this BB cream. I also now have small hives all over my face. At first I thought it was acne, but the spots are coming in places where I don't normally breakout. I have never had acne on my cheeks or eyelids... ever! But now I have these little red spots that are itchy and dry. This is very unfortunate because this was so close to being my favorite product and replacing foundation forever. I have not heard of anyone else having this problem though. I would definitely give the product a try, but beware! I really don't have sensitive skin, but I do get eczema occasionally on my body. I have never had it on my face and I think this product has caused that. Just something to think about...

  29. I have moderate acne with lots of scars and redness. After hearing the beauty gurus rave about BB creams and learning more about how big of a hit they are in Korea, I decided to give it a try. Amazon's Seoul Glamour sold it for around $9 bucks and another few bucks for shipping. This product had no tracking code and was estimated to arrive in a month, but came directly from Korea in less than 2 weeks. I also heard that BB creams are so widely marketed and sought after that many fake ones have emerged. Being the skeptical person I am, I did some research on this counterfeit subject through youtube before applying any to my face. Turns out the product I received was the real deal. I've been using it for almost 2 weeks now. You can wear it alone or under makeup. I do a bit of both every day but always on top of moisturizer because this tends to be hard to massage/blend in by itself. When you wear this without makeup, it does not look very natural because 1) its gray tint and 2) not easy to spread on the skin without adequate moisturizer. Overall, my complexion has gotten a little brighter, and it does not irritate my skin or give me breakouts. I like it alot, but it's not for everybody.
  30. I absolutely love this, I happened to find reviews for it while researching BB creams to decide which one to try, and I'm so happy I picked this one. It's far better than any other BB Creams I have used! I have combination skin and find that no matter what foundation I use, it will always make my skin look and feel oily and I would always break out, which was frustrating. I have tried many kinds of make up, even the mineral make up and nothing has worked even close to how I would like it to. The coverage on this BB Cream is amazing. It does look sort of gray and ashy when you first apply it, but it blends in perfectly within a few minutes and looks natural. I have been using it for a couple weeks now and my skin looks amazing, even after the BB Cream comes off. My skin tone is way more even already, and my skin is soft. I would recommend this to literally everyone. The only con I can really see is that if you have dry skin or some of your skin is dry/combination, you may want to moisturize before applying this. But otherwise, this is absolutely amazing! Not only does my skin never look even slightly oily when I wear it, it looks natural, feels great, improved my skins look and feel, and provides a good sunblock (I've been out in the sun a lot these past few weeks...and am very pale...I did not burn at all, I was very happy. I was very critical when I bought this, thinking it probably wouldn't work as well as everyone else claims it does, but I was surprised to found out it went above even my expectations. I will continue to use for as long as they make it! And it's cut my time to get ready in the morning in half! It's so simple! I really can't praise this product enough, it's the best thing I've ever used on my face!
  31. Professional makeup artist and skin care specialist. I've been searching for the perfect skincare product and I purchased this product in high hopes. There's NOTHING WRONG with this product. There really isn't. I haven't found any problems with it and it's nice. But to be honest, BB creams are nothing more than tinted moisturizers. Save your money, go to the store, and get a nice tinted moisturizer with spf that won't clog pores. They are the EXACT same thing. The ONLY difference is that this is more apt to work on many different skin types because it is not tailored to a certain skin type, which is a plus. But! If you find a nice tinted moisturizer that is good and compatible with YOUR skin, you'll save a lot of money without sacrificing reliability and quality.

  57. Shipping was way faster than I had expected- kudos for that! But the tint wasn't right for me; I wear medium Bare Minerals powder and despite leaving the BB lotion on to absorb, it still had a light/gray hue, making me look like I was sick- or a zombie.<br /><br />The feel of it was great- not drying, not greasy, so I use it for a base for my mineral powder. Between the two products, my freckles and flaws disappeared with an airbrushed appearance and between the 25 SPF of the BB and the 15 SPF of Bare Minerals, I should be OK for the upcoming summer sun.<br /><br />So, if you've purchased this and found it was too light on you, seriously consider using it as a base for Bare Minerals instead of putting it in the back of the drawer with the rest of products that didn't work out.<br /><br />***UPDATE***<br />May 17, 2013<br /><br />I previously purchased a Sigma flat top makeup brush, and just now retried this BB cream using the brush. I stippled it on to ensure it wouldn't go on thick and it's actually not bad! It still isn't 100% my color, but with a little mineral powder touch up and blush, it actually looks pretty good!<br /><br />I used coconut oil for moisturizing, stippled the cream with a Sigma flat-top brush and finished with a light brushing of mineral powder and blush. The application is the crucial part, I guess.

Same texture, same coverage, same application, same feel. SAME SAME SAME. Leave it to Asia to create a new crazy beauty hype. My own mixture that I have been using for some time has reduced the darkness under my eyes and fine lines around my mouth. This cream (used for 2 weeks) seems to allow the creases by my mouth to start to deepen. There is nothing about any facial cream that makes it miraculous.   72. For most of year this color is perfect. I'm fair skinned (but with olive tone) with auburn hair, dark brown eyes and brows. However, it can be a little too pale during summer (esp if I'm tanning) but the BEST thing I found to make this a bit darker without making it orange is to mix a bit of St Tropez Wash Off Instant Glow Face into the BB cream before you apply it to the face.<br /><br />The St. Tropez looks almost black when squeezed out of the tube, but is actually a very thin liquid- almost with a green tint- so it's not a red or orange tan at all. By doing that, it's basically just adding a bit of brown pigment to the cream- and again- it will cancel any redness you may have- which is great for evening your skin tone- because the BB cream (and St Tropez if you try using it, too) does not have the pink, red, or orangey beige pigments like typical makeup does in the States- I've found that mixing that with this BB Cream in summer is my PERFECT color match and it makes my face look flawless, effortless, and clean- not like I'm wearing a lot of makeup. I just love the effect it gives.<br /><br />TRY it!! For the price, it's not a huge gamble. You'll love looking at your skin in your car vanity mirror with all the natural light- because for me that's the true color match test. If a makeup looks good in direct sunlight AND the color matches, it's great in my opinion. Plus did I mention at the end of the day, it still looks good?? Not greasy. Not chalky.

But, really, here's the complete description I found:<br /><br />A triple function blemish balm cream, Skin79's Super Plus BB Cream (Pink Label) shields skin from premature aging with potent SPF 25, while whitening skin and reducing existing lines and wrinkles. The creamy formula effectively covers up skin imperfections, creating a perfect base for makeup and foundation. Skin feels and looks fresh, with a beautiful matte finish all day long. Recommended for combination and oily skin types.<br /><br />Let's see.<br /><br />- Shields skin from premature aging with potent SPF 25 - May be. It doesn't seem to shield it very well though.<br />- While whitening skin and reducing existing lines and wrinkles - I don't think so. Whitening? Definitely not. Reducing existing lines and wrinkles? - I haven't notice any improvement and I don't have many lines.   86. If you are looking for a BB cream that pops out noticeably then this one isn't the right one for you. Skin 79 BB cream is for the all natural look. It blends well with your skin tone and produces minimal side effects of standard makeup foundation such as having that cakey look. More or less, I would describe this BB cream to be more of a tinted moisturizer except with the added benefits of acting in as foundation, base, whitening and sunscreen. I am quite happy with this product, as an Asian with a slightly darker skin tone on my face in comparison to the rest of my body due to sun tan, this works quite well in evening out my skin tone. It hides my red blemishes, doesn't cover up completely some spots but that's what concealer is for and should be used concurrently with this product. I also have oily skin and this product also acts as a matte as well and I quite like it. I am unfortunately not sure how well of a matte though it acts because I live in a desert so its very easy to have oily skin in no time, but in normal conditions such as staying indoors all day, this BB cream does stay on for quite some time. Overall I am very happy with this product and would buy it again especially with this affordable price in comparison to many other brands.

I don't even need to use a foundation anymore. This covers up redness and acne and minor imperfections very well. When I have a lot of pimples I do need to use concealer, but those occasions are rare. Doesn't break me out, and it keeps my oily skin in check if I use a primer under or over it. Sometimes I use primer underneath, but I feel like that prevents all of the goodness of the BB cream to penetrate, so sometimes I will put primer over it and it gives a flawless result either way. Skin looks glowy and perfect. I notice if I wear it for extended periods of time (10-12 hours) or get sweaty, it will start to wear off or settle in my pores and look kind of bad, but it's nothing a touch up with a foundation stick can't fix. My skin is just very bad and this happens with a lot of products any way. You need to try this!

  106. I have oily/combination skin and live in a very humid place which just exacerbates my acne. Even when I received the bb cream (way earlier than expected) I was still apprehensive to try it out because it's almost summer here and my skin had been acting up lately. Well, I've worn it two days now and my skin has actually cleared up a bit! Not going to lie, I don't have very severe acne, not cystic or anything horrible but it's enough that I have red scars on the sides of my cheeks and every day I have a couple little ones. I was also wondering if the coverage would be enough and it's actually just like my foundation when it comes to that aspect. Like others have said the initial color is a very ugly grey but maybe 3 or 5 minutes of putting it onto your face it matches your skin tone. I have very light skin so I dunno how it'd work for darker tones which is sad because bb cream is excellent besides this one thing. The smell is barely noticeable, it's a very light flowery fragrance that completely goes away after a couple of minutes. The seller (seoulglamour) is excellent, the packaging was very cute and they even put in a free sample. The price is very reasonable. Definitely buying again!
  107. Light on the skin and does not leave a \\"cakey\\" feel that most make up does. It has a nice light scent and evens out my skin tone while also protecting my skin from the sun. The design of the bottle is very cute too and convenient because it prevents from mess.
  108. Pros -It makes my face smooth after application -The container is pretty. It dispenses the cream without much of a mess. Cons -I didn't get much coverage. Overall, I like this cream only during the first few hours of application (short-term) as it made my face smoother though it didn't really give much of a coverage.   111. I ordered the Skin79 hot pink BB cream on my other Amazon account and have been using it for several months now. It's a decent BB cream, but I have yet to benefit from all of the \\"triple functions\\" promised. The color seems to have grayish undertones due to the sunscreen. Under fluorescent lighting and in flash photos the cream gives my face a ghastly, grayish cast, despite it looking semi-normal in natural lighting. It whitens pretty well (my skin tone has lightened quite a bit from its use) although some acne scars and redness haven't faded. As far as concealment goes, the coverage is build able but does not hide my tired eyes and acne all too well. I do love the smooth, lotion-like texture of the cream, it has a nice scent and leaves my face soft and smooth. The oil control is also good, it prevents my t-zone from getting too shiny. I'm not old enough for wrinkles yet but I do have laugh lines and this cream does not improve them. Overall this is an average BB cream, it just does not deliver all of the long term benefits it advertises. To sum it up: Pros: Smooth texture and buildable consistency Leaves skin smooth Good oil control Whitens skin color and temporarily evens skin tone Cons: Most effects are only temporary, it's almost like a tinted moisturizer Does not improve wrinkles nor fade acne scars and blemishes Color is grayish and can look unnatural sometimes Does not provide heavy coverage

  114. I've been using this BB a week now and I LOVE it. I've been wearing cover ups since I was 15 and I'm now 32, so I know my foundations. And the great thing about this is it's not a foundation. It's a skin care product w/ the added bonus of a cover-up, so now I don't have to use all those layers of serums, pimple cream, moisturizer, sunblock, foundation, powder.... You name it.<br /><br />I've had problem skin since forever and it's still a problem. I have all these acne scars that I try to hide every day. I have started on laser treatment recently and am getting good results, and I didn't want to jeopardize that by continuing w/ my heavy make-ups, that's why I was looking for a simpler regiment. A friend (Korean, of course) recommended that I try BB cream. This is the 3rd product I've tried and I'm sticking with it.<br /><br />All those other reviews about the BB creams being too light or gray are true. But it's also true that they'll eventually blend to match your skin color. But I have to admit it's not always a perfect match, since each product are slightly different tones. This particular one is a little on the gray side, but then I have an olivey complexion, so it works out. it also has more of a yellow under tone, so it matches my skin more than the American make-ups that usually has peach or pink tone bases. I was called dark by my skincare specialist, but only compared to her other clients. My color is like a light tan.<br /><br />Here's why I love this particular BB cream.<br />- great oil control (my face looks like an oily slick by the end of the day w/ regular make-up. And much sooner when I'm bare faced)<br />- light feel, but good enough coverage that I wear it alone on normal days (it doesn't cover dark spots, so when I go out, I just spot cover with a little of my regular foundation)<br />- evens skin tone greatly. Again, even though it doen't have complete coverage, it evens out my skin that it doesn't look blotchy.<br />- It's super cheap, and the size is not small.<br />- Does not require a lot each application. For me, 3-4 dots for face and neck. The bottle will last a long time.

  117. I recently decided to jump on the BB Cream bandwagon and I am happy I did. I did alot of research and ended up buying Garnier BB Cream at the drugstore. The coverage was so so, which lead me to try different kinds. I LOVE this brand. I have a few sun spots, small amount of wrinkles and this makes my face look like a blank canvas, but not in a clown face kind of way. Very even and very natural. This is actually the first time I have ever applied foundation of any sort. I am always horrifed to see women with caked on face makeup and the color stops at the neck. I didn't want an obvious look, I wanted natural, which I got with this. The coverage is perfect. I live in Florida, so it gets up to 100 degrees. Sweating doesn't affect the makeup at all. This was very important in selecting what BB Cream I chose. I apply the BB Cream after my face moisturizer ( I use emu oil), with my fingers or I use a damp beauty blender makeup sponge (which rocks by the way). One pumps does it, on the top of your hand, then dab away. I dot cheeks, both sides of neck, temples, under my eyes and then forehead. I am a product overuser so I was actually surprised that one pump does do the whole face. The color may appear slightly grey at first, keep blending and don't freak out. I top this with Ben Nye Banana powder (loose powder that stupid Kim Kardashian promoted), and my face looks photo shopped, it's THAT good. One more word of advice, when you think the bottle is empty, it's not. Cut it open and you literally have at the bottom, alot more cream. I read there is alot of fraudulent Skin79 sellers, so watch out for that as well. The bottle I got from this seller is legit. Great experience all the way around. I hope this helps you.

  119. This product exceeded my expectations. The coverage is great (I have some dark hyper pigmentation and a few angry red blemishes) This product covered them well. The Tube is 40 grams (1.4 ounces) and I only needed a small amount to cover my entire face. The cream is very easy to blend and matched my skin perfectly to my skin (NW 25) and my moms (NW 20). If an area needs more coverage, you can dab more BB Cream on the area without the spot becoming cakey or sticky. I let the product set on my face for 5 minutes and was amazed at the transformation. I've never had such natural looking coverage. The finish was slightly matte, which I like and can easily be fixed with some blush and a dab of highlighter. My skin looked flawless and did not look unnatural with flash photography. I set the BB Cream with some light translucent powder (Loreal Translucide) just so I could blend my blush better and because it is a personal preference but I really did not need to. The product felt extremely light on my face and smooth to the touch, I was not left with a sticky residue on my finger like other foundations. The wear seems to be long lasting, however the true test will be in the summer when my skin becomes very slick. My usual coverage routine is Moisterizer + Concealer + Foundation (which takes forever so spackle on my face to get even coverage)+ Finishing Powder, now my routine is BB Cream + Dabs of finishing powder on the oily spots. As for the other properties of improving the skin and lightening scarring, I will update after I have been using the product longer. I ordered from Seoul Glamour and took only 6 days to deliver (from South Korea!!). The product is genuine and I will be ordering a second tube for my mom.

  132. Initally I wasn't going to write a review because there are already so many good reviews, but after reading each review posted on this product I had to add my two cents. So, first I'm going to say that I'm a mid-20's caucasian with combination skin. I have always suffered acne proplems and my skin is usually very oily in my T-zone, especially during the hot, humid summer months. My skin is very fair, light ivory in most foundations and burns extremely easily. I have a face full of freckles from all my burns. Now that I have told you everything about my skin that is important, lets get to the review!<br /><br />I ordered this product about a month ago and have waited to write my review because I wanted to make sure the results were going to last and give the product time to work. The first time I used the product I was very iffy. It has a greyish tint and made me look like a ghost. Since I had read the reviews I was expecting it and knew to give it time to oxidize. After it had oxidized it matched my skin amazingly well and made my skin look flawless! I use about half a pump (don't think anyone using the product properly would need anymore than that) and it covers my whole face very nicely! For those that say it doesn't give enough coverage, I'm guessing they are applying it wrong. After I watched a video, I learned that when you apply it you MUST PAT IT ON, NOT RUB IT IN. This is extremely important. I have tried both rubbing it in and patting it on an (with my fingertips) and the rubbing leaves very little product on your skin to oxidize. With the patting it will easily cover acne, or any other issue you may be using this product for.<br /><br />After a few weeks of using the product I noticed my pores started to shrink. Forgot to note at the top that I have always had very large pores. And that my acne has diminshed immensely! Although I still have some acne, it is not near as bad as it used to be and I have only been using this product for a month! Also since using this product I have had no oil and no sunburns (on my face)! I also must add here that when I have used the product by rubbing it in I did notice oil on my T-zone about half-way through the day. When used by patting it onto the face (as the box recommends), I have experienced no oil problems. I have also noticed a reduction in darkness of my freckles (due to the whitening agent). I didn't notice it first, my husband actually commented on it.<br /><br />I also wanted to address one issue that I saw in a previous review. It was stated that this product is identical to a daily routine and that if you decide to use this product it is because you are lazy! This is not true at all! If you look at the ingredients for this product they are all natural (which can not be said for the foundation, sunscreen, acne treatment and whatever else the reviewer said to use). Also I'm sure that by purchasing all of these products that the reviewer recommened you would be spending much more than the $10 you can purchase this superior product for! Not only is this product all natural but it was also created to rejuvinate and heal skin, which once again those other products were not made to do.<br /><br />Please, if you doubt anything I have said here google this product! There are literally thousands of reviews out there and this product, to me, is unbeatable for the price and the results!

  168. FIRST, Review of the PRODUCT--<br /><br />Love this product! It comes out grayish in color but after application it oxidizes and matches my skin. I sometimes will layer it to get extra coverage where I might need it. I usually apply BAreMinerals foundation over it. I have tried several American BB creams and this is by far the best I have used and you can't beat the price if you shop around. However, BEWARE, there are sellers that say their products are authentic but are in fact, FAKE!<br /><br />This leads to my REVIEW OF THIS SELLER!<br /><br />I had done a fair amount of research on this product before I ever started purchasing it. There are many websites/blogs/videos devoted to educating us on the differences between the fake products and the authentic ones. One such place is:<br /><br />[...]<br /><br />I also read and rely on the feedback and comments made by others regarding the sellers out there. I thought I had made a good choice with this seller. I WAS WRONG! The boxes and the tubes seemed to look authentic. I did notice that the back of the bottles said \\"wrinkle improvement\\" but the front of the bottles said 'wrinkle free\\". Apparently, the real product has had both descriptions but it raised my suspicions. It wasn't until I squirted out the product that I noticed that the application button was more \\"springy\\" that any of my previous bottles. The application usually has a \\"firm\\" feel to it, not springy feeling or sounding. The product itself was more watery and had a pink/peach appearance instead of the gray color I'm used to. When I rubbed it on my skin, it had a very watery feel and had virtually no coverage effect. As it dried, it took on a whitish film color and dried sticky. The feel and appearance looked and felt like I had spread elmer's glue on my skin. YUCK. I popped the actual tube out of the pink outer cover by pushing up with my thumb on the nozzle. The fake products have a tube extending down into the main chamber. Guess what? Both bottles had this tube. I'm sure the sellers/manufacturers out there that want to sell the fake stuff will fix that difference soon as they have many of the others differences that distinguish between the authentic and fake products. The bottom line is the actual product looks and feels totally different from the authentic product. This seller posts that he/she sells the Authentic product and this is simply a lie.<br /><br />SHAME ON YOU!<br /><br />Luckily, I returned both bottles to amazon and got my money back!!!!!!<br /><br />I have since purchased my SKIN 79 HOT PINK BB CREAM from PINK GELEE. It IS AUTHENTIC and I will purchase from them from now on. They even sent a thank you note with my purchase along with several samples.

It just looks all-around healthy, matte, even, and bright. I chose Skin79 over other brands because I wasn't looking for dramatic coverage or anything like that; I just wanted a \\"one-stop shop\\" sort of skin product that would help the minor issues I have with my skin while being healthy for it as well. Prior to this, I didn't wear anything on my skin at all -- no foundation, primer, concealer, anything -- so I can't speak as to whether it can/should take the place of all those other products for people who use them regularly. I suppose that might make me more sensitive to feeling \\"heavy\\" with any sort of product on, but I'm happy to say that Skin79 barely feels like anything at all.   196. I've completely switched over from foundation to BB creams (Korean brands only since US BB creams are basically just tinted moisturizers which does not have the same consistency, coverage, or benefits of Korean BB creams). Missha was the first BB cream I tried, and I thought it was okay but it made my face look too gray and ashy, and the coverage wasn't great either. It didn't give off the natural matte look that I prefer for my skin. I gave up on BB creams for a while because of it and went back to my MUFE HD Foundation. Then I noticed the rave reviews that Skin79 was getting for their BB creams so I started using Skin79 hot pink BB cream, which I fell in love with. It gave me a newfound hope for BB creams. It made my skin look really matte and natural- the coloring is great. The gray ashiness that you first get right after application oxidizes within 15 minutes to a beautiful finish that matches my skin tone really well. I started using the gold version, which I equally love, for when I want a more dewy natural look since it's more moisturizing than the hot pink version. I wear all of my BB cream with Laura Geller Spackle Under Primer (clear) and I set my BB cream with Maybelline Dream Matte Powder for a super matte finish or Sonia Kashuk Bare Minimum Pressed Powder for a more skin-like natural look.<br />I ordered the Lioele Triple the Solution BB Cream out of curiosity, and after applying it on my skin I was pleasantly surprised at how beautiful my skin looks! It is light and it doesn't oxidize as much as Skin79, but the finish makes my skin look like my skin only muchmuch better. I'm in love! I am now awaiting the Lioele Beyond the Solution because I want a BB Cream with no SPF version for when I know I'm going to have my picture taken since SPF reflects light particles, making your face super white and glowy in photographs. Also, I read that the Beyond the Solution has a more natural coloring since there's no SPF (no white ashiness like most BB cream start out with) so no waiting to oxidize!<br />So in conclusion, I highly recommend these BB Creams: Skin79 Hot Pink, Skin79 Gold, Lioele Triple the Solution, and I am pretty sure I will love Lioele Beyond the Solution as well but if not I'll update this review! :)<br />Forgot to mention that these above BB creams lasts all day and stays pretty matte on my super oily skin! I never have to blot!

I have fair skin and have had acne all of my teenage and adult life. I also have a fair amount of freckles. My skin has finally cleared up and while I don't need a full coverage foundation anymore, I need a lot more than a tinted moisturizer can provide to help cover the freckles and some scarring. I've always hated the way a full coverage, long lasting foundation felt and looked but I felt like I had no other options. It hides my imperfections but doesn't look cakey or overly made up. plus, it feels fantastic! I do use a setting powder and a setting spray because I have oily skin and I feel like a dewy finish always looks slightly oily on me. I think this will be my daily foundation routine for a long time to come. FYI it does have a slight scent but I find that it smells soapy and pleasant, not at all over powering.<br />For anyone who's curious, the regimen that finally cleared my skin up was washing with African Black Soap twice daily and following that up with Dr. Hauschka's clarifying toner. The soap is cheap but the toner is on the pricey side. Worth a shot if you've tried everything else =)
  200. So I read good reviews about this bb cream, but the only problem I was coming across was people saying it won't work on a non white skin tone. So I decided to try the product, im a nc35 and the product came out good on me! It comes out grayish and blends into your skin, leaving a flawless look! My sister who's a nc40 used it as well, at it adjusted to her color as well as mine! I don't think it would work for darker tone, but I definitely know you don't have to be a nc25 or less to use it.

I am asian so this matched my skin color better than Revlon Colorstay which I used before this. It also has lots of skin benefits and SPF so that's a plus.   202. I'm not much for reviews but because of all of the positive reviews I saw here I am now a proud owner of this amazing product! I received this bb cream on 9/2/12 so I' ve been using it for 5 days now and I' ve already ordered my 2nd bottle. Now I have fair, smooth oily skin, I don't have any acne however I can brakeout like crazy if I use makeup that adds oil. This BB not only gives you great coverage but makes your skin almost glow, it helps to keep my oily face nice and dry and my other makeup just falls into place and stays there. Now, yes it does have a grey ash color but as you blend it in the BB will match your color, a little goes a long way so use about 5 small pumps and spread evenly with a concealer brush.<br /><br />*UPDATE* 10/10/2012<br /><br />Ok. So I thought it fair to update my review since there's some issues that can change your mind. I am sad to report that I am returning both of my BB creams to the seller because I feel that I bought fakes. I was developing a rash so I started eliminating products until finally I had to admit it was the BB cream. I sought out information online on how to spot a fake and I found that there are a lot of contradictions. The ones I bought seem to be ok, however the BB on one of them has completely rubbed off and the other one is slowly fading. I am not sure if is because is a fake or because it's out in the open. To be sure I went to the Skin79 website where they only provide you with one sure way of verifying authenticity which is to check the silver sticker on the back of your bottle. If you go to their website it will show you the difference between an original sticker and a tampered one. At first glance mines seem to be ok, but if you place it under the light it does look like the tampered image they show you. I have decided to buy the BB cream straight from the Skin79 website just to be sure, it's a little more but I rather pay more and have a piece of mind than be cheap and pay for it with my face. Good luck!!
  203. it broke me out, but it seems all foundations do that to me:(<br />Why I love it:<br />-I love that it reduces the redness on my face and I love how it makes my skin tone took brighter like in a clean way.<br />-It minimizes my pores. I have huge pores and they are often hard to conceal even when I use primer, but once this settles on my face my pores become invisible.<br />-It's also a skincare product.   209. Hi! So I ordered the pink and gold skin79 BB creams after researching dozens of BB creams(I'll admit, there were a few others which looked like they could be better than skin79's, but the bottle shape and color won me over HAHA)<br /><br />Little bit about me: Never used bb creams before, this is my first time ordering. Literally just got it out of the mail, only blended it on my hand, will update this when I start using it like tomorrow, but so far blends very well; I'm asian and have really pale skin and can't even tell it's on my arm!! There is a very light fragrant smell, the pink version feels more light than the gold, gold will probably be better for the dry winter time. I bought the gold version for my mom, but now that I look back the orange one seems it might be better for her skin, as it has higher SPF and she has a lot of sun spots on her cheeks.<br /><br />My delivery experience: I bought the 2 bottles from Pink Gelee, because I did not find any mixed comments about fake vs real products as SeoulGlamour/other sellers. After I ordered it, I immediately sent an email to Pink Gelee. I figured it wouldn't hurt to ask bluntly if they were real or not, and then I'd check it when the package came in. I received a reply promptly the next day, guaranteeing that their products are 100% guaranteed authentic. She even linked me a site to check the authenticity, and although that was reassuring I was not ready to give in the towel until I had the product in front of me and I could check for myself. The product came very promptly, first day of the estimated delivery date. (They are based in LA, and I live 30 minutes from there so that might be a factor to consider when ordering) Inside included a card saying thank you and a sample of the Pink and Gold versions, which was sweet (but I sorta just bought those 2... I kinda wished it was the orange vita plus sample :c )<br /><br />My overview on the authenticity: So it came in the mail today and I readily checked all thebookmarked links of how to tell if it's real or not. The thing though, about these photos are that Skin79 changes their packages regularly, probably to fool the people who are making fakes out there. The front label on the box and on the bottle says \\"Wrinkle Improvement\\" instead of Wrinkle Free. That freaked me out, because some of the 'Real' versions out there shows Wrinkle Free. Upon further studying and research, I found out that Skin79 recently changed their products to say Wrinkle Improvement, so +1 there. To all of you who just bought one recently and your bottle still says Wrinkle Free, :'( idk, check the date if it's 2012, should say Wrinkle Improvement! Also as a side note, those who say \\"oh, your product is fake if the labeled words scratch off,\\" that's just silly. Almost anything can be scratched off if it's out in heat, or dry areas long enough. I also found comments of a person who talked to a representative of cute and pretty, who sells authentic skin79 products, who even said that the label can scratch off, real or fake, if it's been let out in the sun or in different conditions long enough. So I think I'm going to skip that test, haha... not going to sit here and try to scratch off my brand new product to base if it's real or not.<br /><br />Second, the barcode should be on the bottom of the box; mine was on both products, as well as the expiration date and the manufacturing date. The manufacturing date was very recent as well, sometime this year, and expiration date in 2014. On the bottle itself there was also a sticker of authenticity, the gold version wasn't as nicely placed as the pink bottle.. it was slightly crooked, which made me worried. Perforated lines on both boxes were shown as well.<br /><br />Third, If you read inside the box, on the English part I found a typo: it said Wriinkle Improvement. I was like, damn, this is a fake. HOWEVER, after some research I found a lady who bought it full price from a local authorized retailer, and the real product also has this typo, which made me extremely relieved.<br /><br />Fourth, as a last check, I pumped a little on my hand. I've read that if it comes out leaky or watery, it's fake. It came out finely mixed, in one unison color and was lightly fragrant. The pink took like literally 20+ pumps to get it going, and the white only 1 or 2 pumps.<br /><br />After all this, I am almost sure now that the product I got was an authentic skin79 product. If you've kept up with me so far, hooray! You are now more informed! These are the elaborate reasons why I think my product is legit. I'll be buying from her from now on, unless someone finds new information to prove me wrong.
  210. I ordered this product with high hopes.<br /><br />Pros: Evens out skin tone, covers blemishes and controls oil really well<br /><br />Cons: Caused a slight breakout along my chin and unfortunately didn't match my skin tone perfectly.   212. Age: Mid 20s<br />Skin: Dry, Sensitive, Recently Acne-Prone<br />Color: Fair<br /><br />After perusing around on the Internets for a product that could help even out skin tone but that wouldn't require a heavy foundation or ten layers of a thin product, I came across this gem, which is mentioned on multiple YouTube Beauty Channels. I must say, I'm so impressed! I wasn't holding out high hopes, as my skin has become a source of stress and irritation lately, but I'm loving this product!<br /><br />Let me start off by saying that I'm very fair-skinned (Caucasian), and this product is made for light skin tones. However, I wasn't exactly holding my breath for a miracle or anything the first time I put it on, but within 3 minutes of massaging this in, I literally looked at myself in the mirror and said \\"woah\\" and had to do an inspection. The redness on my cheeks was totally evened out, and the minor fading blemishes I had on my cheek somehow looked more like freckles than healing acne (I'm talking 1 week since they started healing away, not full-blown height of breakout). After that major improvement, I was a little bummed to see that the hyper-pigmentation along my jawline was still pretty noticeable, but with a bit of concealer, those were just a faded memory (har har). After an hour or so, I did notice that the product had settled a tiny bit into the wrinkle on my forehead (I have this weird single vertical wrinkle between my eyebrows that is pretty deep for my age), but with just a light hand, I massaged it away; I didn't notice any settling in other fine lines that are starting to form on my face, like around my mouth and eyes. I should note though that I did not set this with a powder, as I have very dry skin and wasn't sure if you were supposed to do that anyway!<br /><br />The packaging is great; it looks mid-end (as in, not cheap but not super expensive IMO), and the little pump works great. There isn't any way to tell how much product is left though, as the packaging is too opaque. I'm also not sure how the pump is designed inside, but I'm guessing there will be a fair amount of product that won't be able to be used at the end. Since I don't even need a full pump for my whole face, I'm guessing it will last a while, and the lost bit at the end will just be a part of the deal, though a bit of a bummer. I've only had it for a week, so I can't comment at all on how long one bottle lasts.<br /><br />The only reason I gave this 4 instead of 5 stars is because I used the Skin79 chart (on their website) to choose if I wanted this item (pink) versus the gold version, and that chart led me to believe this would better suit my skin. However, I wish I had gotten the gold, as it is not supposed to be as drying as the pink (found that out from blog entries and reviews after purchasing this--d'oh!). I used a light moisturizer on my face before applying this the first time (just Olay's sensitive skin lotion), and within an hour, the dryness around my nose was driving me crazy! The second time around, I slathered on 2 heavy layers of lotion and made it a solid 5 or 6 hours before I felt that my face was getting too dry. I'm going to try the Cetaphil cream under this to see if that helps me go the whole day, as that seems to be the gold standard for those with sensitive skin, but who also require a lot of moisture.<br /><br />From what I've read, this pink version is better for those with oily skin. It is also slightly thicker and has a bit better coverage, so if you're on the fence between pink and gold, and are looking for something a bit more heavy-duty, maybe this is better for you than the gold. However, if your skin is dry, go for the gold my friend!<br /><br />I also want to point out that my skin has become unbelievably sensitive over the last few months and this somehow does not irritate my skin. Even the Neutrogena sensitive skin lotion did not play well with my face, and this has caused no issues (except a bit of dryness) aftera week of use. If the Cetaphil heavy-duty stuff does not moisturize enough for me to use the Pink version (since I already paid for it), I'll switch over to the Gold and hopefully have the same experience, minus the dryness. But so far, I LOVE this product, and I hardly ever say that about beauty stuff! The number one benefit is evening out the redness on my cheeks and it does that SO WELL without looking like I have anything on my face. It's like your own skin, but better!
  213. Love this product! I usually use this or the Gold ( which is a bit more heavy, and not quite as pale ), and I refuse to buy anything else.<br /><br />Shipping was prompt, and product was packaged nicely. By far the best BB cream I have ever used.

  257. My first impressions were: FUN PACKAGING! I love the sanitary pump. I use half a pump and pat it on, it goes on so creamy and matte that I don't even need powder. I have light/olive skin tone and with a high oil volume in the tzone with dry cheeks. I use proactive for acne prevention and I was kinda scared to try a new BB cream. But i am a true believer now! I wear Skin79 BB Cream everyday and one bottle lasted about 4months. When it got low I took a tip I learned from another reviewer and popped the pump open and used a q-tip to scoop out the inner tube while I waited for my new one to arrive. Any time I had a friend over I would brag and give out samples. I love it so much I even offer to buy their bottle from them if they don't like it! I haven't had any complaints and so far 3 of my friends have switched. This BB cream is matte with a fresh dew though out the day and easy to wash off at night. It has a very very light flowery powder smell that dissipates. Ive heard other reviews make note about the 'gray' tint when they first apply, I would suggest that you continue patting it around your face to redistribute. Maybe it is just thick in that area. Give it a few minutes to 'settle' in and voila!

  290. So this is the first BB cream I've ever purchased and although I don't have any other BB creams to compare it with, I gave it 4 stars.   291. This is one of my favorite BB creams to date. This BB cream can be intimidating to some people, but this particular one is great for anyone, especially for new BB cream users. This one looks particularly gray, but like every BB cream, it will adjust. I have read a lot of reviews about how the color adjusts after an hour, but those people are tripping. I timed it, and it adjusts WITHIN 15 minutes. This cream has a lovely light floral scent. It feels very light and offers a light to medium coverage, whereas usually BB creams offer medium to heavy coverage. This one doesn't really have great buildable coverage like typical foundations and other BB creams - it'll look like you're wearing a gray mask if you attempt a second application. If you're afraid of the gray tone or find this BB cream too light even after waiting for it to adjust, mix in a dab of foundation or concealer that is a shade or two darker than your own. I use NC25 in MAC, Bisque in Laura Mercier (tinted moisturizer), Golden Medium in Bare Escentuals, and L3 in Smashbox, I40 in Shiseido, and Ivory in Hourglass (tinted moisturizer) and this BB cream is slightly lighter for me during the summer. I definitely do not recommend this one for anyone with oily skin, because even on my combination skin my face sometimes feels oily after a long day. No matter your skin type, always use moisturizer before you apply BB cream. Overall, this is a nice BB cream, most fit for BB cream newbies.

Some warned of scams, others that this one was great for their combination skin, or better for dry skin, etc. My mom has dry skin and I have combination skin that freaks out during that time of the month, leaving me with red scars and faint spots on my fair skin. She recommended one type, but of course I ordered this one after reading all the reviews.<br /><br />Disappointing :( This BB cream did exactly what I was wanting to avoid, it made my skin itch, especially in hot and humid conditions, and the color was just slightly off and didn't adapt to my skin color. The worst part, it didn't even cover up my blemishes! Even if I tried to apply extra layers, it's as if it's afraid of spots! My skin, fine wrinkles, breakouts, acne scars and all, basically looked similar to how it does without any makeup. Soooo, I gave in when my mom ordered me her kind - I was afraid it would be too heavy for my skin, making the oily areas oilier. Instead, it covered great, didn't itch or make me breakout (which I think the other one may have - it definitely clogged my pores!!), and it moisturized without feeling heavy. I just blot with a tissue sometimes before applying a light layer of powder. I recommend Dr. Jart+ Black Label Detox Healing Blemish Base BB Cream SPF25 PA++ Whitening Anti Wrinkle 1.7oz/50g. At the time I was looking, it was more than double the price, now it's very inexpensive and I think way better in terms of coverage and making you look like the examples in the ads!!<br /><br />If lighter (like a tinted moisturizer) coverage is what you're going for this may work for you, unfortunately I learned the hard way it doesn't work for me!

  320. First let me start by saying the product feels great on my skin, and has a light pleasant scent. I can barely tell there is anything on my face, it doesnt feel oily at all. The coverage is pretty good, I usually only need a little concealer under my eyes. I had been using another brand of BB cream (a drugstore brand, which I hear isnt a \\"real\\" bb cream), but it was too dark for me and my skin felt greasy.<br /><br />The BB Cream I purchased had the perforated box, tamper-evident sticker, large pink circle on top of box and 4 diff languages inside, manufacture and expiration dates and just about everything I've read the real package and box should have. The only difference was that it says wrinkle improvement, while the one in the picture on Amazon said wrinkle free. I found out that product for Korean distributors say wrinkle improvement, while for US distributors it says wrinkle free. Also the product for Korean distributors has Korean on outside of package. I saw the word WIZCOZ on bottles so I went to their website and was able to confirm that is the same as the bottle I got. I've heard PinkGelee, Seoulglamour, &neverprice all sell real product, I got mine from Emmas.
  321. My expectation was higher then usual having seen really good reviews on Amazon for this product. I also heard a lot about BB creams recently so I was curious to try. It made my face shiny and not really natural looking, like a little heavy and weighted down. If you like using powder or Bare Minerals, I do not recommend this product as it can look heavy. Anyhow, this review is solely based on the look and not any skin healing effects that it may or may not provide. I'm a makeup junkie and have tried a ton of products and I wish I could give away my almost new and full bottle of Skin 79 as I won't be using it anymore.

  327. I have very sensitive, very fair skin that's oily in the T-zone and acne-prone. I've had four or five incidents of contact dermatitis in the last six months from makeup and other skin products I've used without problems for five or six years (I'm 25), so I've been looking very hard for something my sensitive skin can handle.<br /><br />This is day two of using this BB cream and overall, I have to say I really like it. First, and most importantly, my skin didn't react by turning all red, blotchy, and flaky - hurray! It goes on a bit grey, but oxidizes after a few minutes to match my skin color pretty closely. It's almost too dark for my skin color, but it's not that noticeable unless you're specifically looking for it. I used my fingertips to pat it on and had a pretty flawless finish after setting it with a little mineral powder. It's very creamy and blends easily. I'd say the coverage is medium - it covered up dark spots and old acne scars with no trouble at all, but there were a few spots that were still quite obvious. I just dabbed a little more on those spots and they disappeared. I was very impressed that I didn't have to worry about blotting until about mid-afternoon, and for the most part the cream stayed on my face and not on the blotting sheets. Not sure how well it would hold up in humid conditions or while sweating, but it's perfect for cooler weather.<br /><br />The reason I didn't give this five stars is because it made me break out a little bit. I'm going to keep using it for a while because another review I read said that her skin got used to it, but I've developed a few deep, painful pimples around my chin area - the kind that give you a headache. I'm really hoping my skin will adjust because this product feels AMAZING on my skin and it's the first product I've tried in MONTHS that my skin hasn't had an immediate negative reaction to. I would definitely recommend it to anyone with sensitive skin, but if you're acne-prone you'll want to make sure you're treating your problem areas with something extra.<br /><br />Update 12/05/2012: I have given this product three weeks and I'm sad to say that I'll be passing it along to my mom when I go home to visit over Christmas. The breakouts have been terrible, especially around my chin, and they don't go away even with multiple acne medications. I'm rather disappointed because everywhere I DIDN'T break out, my skin looks fantastic! I had several dark spots from old acne breakouts that have completely disappeared and my skin tone looks much more even. If your skin isn't acne-prone like mine, you may be able to use this without trouble.

Things I did not like about this BB Cream:<br />1. The cream wouldn't absorb into my skin entirely, regardless of what I did. I tried putting it on with nothing underneath, putting it on after putting on a toner, after applying moisturizer, etc. My 24% zinc oxide facial sunscreen absorbs more easily than this stuff.<br />2. My skin really does not like silicones, and this BB Cream started to irritate my skin after awhile.<br />3. You need a make up remover to take this off.<br />4. Fragrance. Again, irritated my skin.<br />5. Arbutin. I understand that a lot of Asian skincare products contain arbutin (whitening agent), and that it's more natural than hydroquinone, but there's that study out there that shows intestinal bacteria transforms arbutin into hydroquinone and I really just want nothing to do with hydroquinone.<br /><br />I love the idea of a 3-in-one product (moisturizer, foundation, sunscreen), but this BB Cream just did not work with my skin, unfortunately.

  352. I have oily skin, a few sun spots and no pimples or visible blemishes or scar that I need to cover up with foundation. Between the Gold and the Red bottle, I believe the Gold bottle works best for my skin. It brightens up my skin and I looked radiant. The effect is long lasting well into the evening and my make up stays. I often receive compliments about my skin. It also melts away quickly in a few hours after application so my make up slides as a result. I don't think the Red bottle is good for oily skin at all. I would recommend you buy a few different ones to try on and compare in order to find the right one that works best for your skin. We are all different and our skin changes over time too.   358. I've never been one who was particularly excited for the BB creams in the US. Sunscreen severely burns my face, and I'm very sensitive to the majority of foundations that are available. The concealer I used prior to using this BB cream even made my face burn from the light spf 15 it contained, so I'll admit I was slightly fearful of trying any of them out, including this one. I had recently seen a documentary talking about what's perceived as beautiful in different cultures, especially the ones that were particularly contrasting. The documentary briefly brought up the desire for pale preserved skin in most Asian countries as opposed to the desired golden goddess tan desired in the North American countries. I won't advocate which I find more attractive, for I do believe that the majority of what we consider beautiful is relative and cultural; but, I will say that I advocate preserving my own skin from sun damage. I might not be the palest, but I'm Irish, German, and most likely any other Nordic orientation that results in severe sunburn, so the preserved look is a safer option for me.<br /><br />After seeing the documentary I did some searching for asian skincare products, and I inevitably came upon the Skin79 BB Cream. It was much more popular than I expected, so I'll admit I'm probably very behind on discovering this product. Anywho, I picked the pink one first because it contained a few more interesting ingredients than the orange and gold versions (in my personal opinion). I was instantly amazed at what it claimed it could do, but skeptical too of course. It was supposed to tighten the skin to eliminate wrinkles, smooth the appearance of the skin over all, and whiten the skin (which made me think of bleach initially but it's much less scary than something that intense), all while having a very high spf. Oh, and it's a foundation of course. I'm sure US BB creams have some of the same attributes, but just because of the cultural beauty differences I decided to go with this Korean one first.<br /><br />I was astounded at the results.<br /><br />Some people claimed it left a grayish cast, but I must have a grayish face, because it matched my skin color perfectly. I applied it in tiny amounts all over my face like a moisturizer, and unlike most foundations I've used (I'm a serious makeup fanatic) it felt like my skin was light and airy. It didn't feel heavy like a foundation at all, but the coverage was undeniable. I have acne and a peach tint to my skin, and instantly my skin tone looked even and flawless. The pimples were still evident, however, but I had expected this. This allowed me to use just a teensy drop of concealer in trouble spots as opposed to all over my face like usual. There was also an almost pearly luminescent quality to the overall look of my skin, which made it look very healthy. I'm a dancer, and after a 6 hour rehearsal and sweating it did not come off like my other foundations had. Best of all, there was no burning at all! I couldn't even smell the sunscreen. All and all, I was an extremely happy camper.<br /><br />Some things to consider: I'm not incredibly pale, but I am pale enough that this BB cream matched perfectly with my skin, so someone that's darker complected or has an olive tone might want to try some of the others that are tinted differently. Wash this off before bed! It will make you break out if you don't, so don't go straight to bed even if you're just rolling in at 1 a.m...I also felt that my skin was tighter and wrinkles elimininated. I am very young however, so I don't have many wrinkles, and it's possible it was simply a placebo effect. Don't apply a lot! It doesn't take much at all to create the desired effect, and too much will make it seem like it's too oily. Applying a little will keep the face hydrated and feeling light as air without being greasy.<br /><br />To conclude, I definitely encourage anyone looking for a BB cream to purchase one from Skin79.<br /><br />Hope I've helped!ith this Korean one first.<br /><br />I was astounded at the results.<br /><br />Some people claimed it left a grayish cast, but I must have a grayish face, because it matched my skin color perfectly. I applied it in tiny amounts all over my face like a moisturizer, and unlike most foundations I've used (I'm a serious makeup fanatic) it felt like my skin was light and airy. It didn't feel heavy like a foundation at all, but the coverage was undeniable. I have acne and a peach tint to my skin, and instantly my skin tone looked even and flawless. The pimples were still evident, however, but I had expected this. This allowed me to use just a teensy drop of concealer in trouble spots as opposed to all over my face like usual. There was also an almost pearly luminescent quality to the overall look of my skin, which made it look very healthy. I'm a dancer, and after a 6 hour rehearsal and sweating it did not come off like my other foundations had. Best of all, there was no burning at all! I couldn't even smell the sunscreen. All and all, I was an extremely happy camper.<br /><br />Some things to consider: I'm not incredibly pale, but I am pale enough that this BB cream matched perfectly with my skin, so someone that's darker complected or has an olive tone might want to try some of the others that are tinted differently. Wash this off before bed! It will make you break out if you don't, so don't go straight to bed even if you're just rolling in at 1 a.m...I also felt that my skin was tighter and wrinkles elimininated. I am very young however, so I don't have many wrinkles, and it's possible it was simply a placebo effect. Don't apply a lot! It doesn't take much at all to create the desired effect, and too much will make it seem like it's too oily. Applying a little will keep the face hydrated and feeling light as air without being greasy.<br /><br />To conclude, I definitely encourage anyone looking for a BB cream to purchase one from Skin79.<br /><br />Hope I've helped!

  364. I don't normally like to leave reviews, but I felt this deserves one.<br /><br />A little information about my skin tone - I am somewhat in between fair and medium. I do not have a big problem with my skin, although it is combination-oily. I break out occasionally, but not excessively. I like to use as little makeup as possible, but I normally use a primer and a tinted moisturizer for my face.<br /><br />Anyway, I did a little research on BB creams, since some of my friends have been talking about it. I ordered Maybelline's Dream Fresh BB Cream, but I found out after lots of research that it was just another moisturizer, not a \\"true\\" BB cream. So back to the research I went - I came across quite a lot and decided to try my luck with Skin79's product(s). I've read that the Pink Label's more for those with oily skin (ideal for the summer), the Gold for dry (ideal for winter season, as many reviewers have said), and the Orange falls between the two. I ordered this from seoulglamour (09/01/2012) and the product arrived today.<br /><br />I was pretty excited to try it out! And I have to say that the results so far are amazing. I used a full pump (if you want lesser coverage, half a pump should do) and patted it on my face as instructed. It oxidized as soon as I was done setting it with some translucent powder. I noticed a huge difference with my skin tone - it covered up my dark spots and blemish scars. It doesn't exactly cover it that you can't see it; it sort of evens out those areas to give my face a more even skin tone, if that makes any sense. But that can always be fixed with some concealer. It also brightened up my face, which I was really surprised to see. It really does a good job with oil control for me, so I have not broken out since using it.<br /><br />This is now my go-to makeup every day - saves me a number of steps in my daily routine. I am saying goodbye to my primer and tinted moisturizer! I will definitely be re-ordering this when I run out. I may purchase the Gold one as well, if the Pink Label isn't suitable for Winter.

  404. This was my first time using this product and I received it in early January and I wanted to have a considerable amount of time of using this before I wrote a review on it.<br /><br />About myself... I've always had skin problems since I can remember. I'm acne prone, scar easily, and have uneven skin tone. I smoked for 5 years and completely quit since Sept. 2011 when I found out I was pregnant. After having my baby in May 2012, my face has been breaking out non-stop even to this day. I don't think I've ever broken out so much before. On the skin79 website, there is this little test of sorts that you can take to see which of their products is the best for you. I wish I had done that before buying this since I feel like this was not the right product for me.<br /><br />The coverage is very light, which is not good for me since I have a bit of acne and a bunch of dark spots where my old zits used to be. So if you're in this same boat as me, don't throw away your concealer/foundation - you'll be needing it! The whitening feature did help my skin significantly. The heaviest of my dark spots are noticeably lighter and the lighter dark spots have faded away completely. My skin tone does even out nicely once the cream sets in.<br /><br />Once my current supply runs out, I'm going to try another cream within the skin79 line that is supposed to be more suited towards my skin type. If that doesn't work out then I will buy this again. It is not a bad product at all; it does work a little bit but it's just not quite right for me.<br /><br />About authenticity and my seller, Pink Gelee:<br />Normally I don't talk about any of the sellers in my review but I thought I should since many people are questioning authenticity and whatnot. I believe without a doubt that my bottle is 100% authentic. There are a few blogs dedicated to authenticating skin79's products so I won't go into detail here. Just Google &#34;skin79 authentic&#34; or something like that. When I did receive my bottle, I went to one of the blogs and did a thorough comparison as well as watching a youtube video on it.<br /><br />My experience is with Pink Gelee only and I'm in no way trying to discredit any other sellers since I have no knowledge of them. I believe the company is located in California and I received my package fairly fast. It's important to me to have my sellers located in the U.S. so that it doesn't take forever for something to reach me from overseas and I don't want to have to deal with customs, etc. Pink Gelee will be my go-to company. I couldn't have been more pleased with them.

  419. I saw all the raves on this SKIN79 Super+ Beblesh Balm BB Cream Triple Function ( Pink Label ) and thought how it would live up to the hype. As I am getting older, my skin feels drier and I do not like mineral powder as much anymore because it seems to make my pores more obvious. This was not my first BB cream and maybe if it was, I would have liked it more. This BB cream was so thick! Don't get me wrong, it was very easy to spread but the coverage was not good for me (it takes about two layers to cover like another product with just one layer). The thickness made it feel like I had a layer of foundation on and my skin felt tight even though I moisturized and I moisturize with all my BB creams with no issues. There was a floral scent that was very light and didn't seem to bother me. Also, everyone already knows there's a grayish cast. This was no surprise to me, and I thought I would liked it regardless. But, there are other SKIN79 BB creams that are not as thick and do not feel like another layer on my skin. Perhaps this product has great reviews because it's been out there (I heard it was one of the first popular BB cream in Korea). People tend to stick with what works for them, so maybe people are okay with how it feels because it's the first few BB creams that they've tried or it really just works for their skin. Just note that BB creams are good for making skin tone even or hiding pores and small blemishes but they do not cover pimples completely. This cream could not even cover my blemishes although it did even my skin tone and cover my pores. I've seen YouTube videos where some people use up to three layers of this cream and then concealer. Why would I want to use that much if another BB cream can do what I need in just one layer? No wonder some people are breaking out from this product.<br />I own 12 different BB creams - half of them which are samples. The hot pink was also a sample and I've tried the gold as well. The gold felt more moisturizing but also felt too thick and the coverage was more sheer. I've tried the SKIN79 Lovely Girls and SKIN79 Chiffon BB mousse, which are newer, has thinner textures, and sheer to light coverage that actually makes my blemishes less obvious. Also, they have NO gray cast (I heard the Skin79 Snail Nutrition BB cream has a peachy tone which I have the sample for and will try). Some of the other brands I've tried that I love are Holika Holika Luminous Silk BB cream and Elishacoy Noblesse Naturalism Always Triple BB Cream which do what I want BB creams to do minus any odd scents/thickness/gray cast. These don't have a lot of reviews but I searched blogs to find these. My best advise is to get samples; there are a lot of sellers that provide samples when you made a purchase so that you can try different brands before you commit to anything.
  420. What a great product!<br /><br />First of all:<br /><br />1. Do not buy American BB cream. Buy this. American BB cream is just tinted moisturizer. This is different.<br /><br />2. Try the sample that Amazon sells if you haven't used this before. It comes with 4 types and you can see if you like them at all and if so, what shade you like!<br /><br />I'm a redhead with pale skin and this is great. Covers up some of my red tone in my skin (which is good) and matches very well. This may not work if you're tan / olive but if you're pale, these Korean products match pretty well!<br /><br />It's a bit thicker than a tinted moisturizer but feels so sheer. I literally do not feel like I'm wearing makeup. It also doesn't look obvious or cakey at all but covers really well. You can layer on more if you need more coverage but a little pump of it is plenty for me most days.<br /><br />So far, no skin issues as a result. I have sensitive skin and this hasn't irritated it. It's hard to say yet if it's helping cut down on my breakouts but I'm optimistic. Also, it has SPF 25 which is great. It kept me from getting burnt the last time I was outside for a few hours (not SUPER sunny but fairly sunny all day and I would normally have been pink afterwards!)
