  431. I am a self confessed beauty product junkie. Having tried dozens, if not hundreds of foundations, tinted moisturizers, concealers, etc over the years, I can finally at 30 years old stop the search, because I have found my holy grail of skin cosmetics in Skin 79 Beblesh Balm. Here's some information about my skin type so you can compare before you purchase:<br /><br />1. I am a fair skinned caucasian with both pink and yellow undertones. My skin tone is best describes as neutral fair ivory.<br />2. I have almost no sun damage as I do not go tanning and avoid the sun. My only sun exposure was when I was in my teens and early 20's and stupidly used tanning beds for a few weeks here and there. I do not desire a tan, either, which is important to note if you want to use this product because it has whitening agents and spf 25.<br />3. I smoked for 12 years before quitting 2 years ago and have tiny fine lines under my eyes. Other than that the only wrinkles I have are expression lines on my forehead.<br />4. I have oily, acne prone skin, though I keep it in check with Duac and Retin-A micro.<br />5. Despite having oily skin, I get dry after cleansing and must use a lightweight lotion (Cera Ve).<br />6. I have eczema, also held in check with proper moisturizing. I tend towards having sensitive skin.<br />7. I am extremely diligent about washing my face every morning and night, completely removing all traces of makeup.<br /><br />The reason I outlined all of that for you is because it is important to take note that this product WILL NOT fit every skin type and tone, and it is not intended to. It is designed for Asian skin, and in most eastern cultures having fair, untanned skin is highly desirable, unlike western cultures where everyone spray tans to death.<br /><br />That being said, this product applies like a dream: creamy, balmy, but not greasy. At first appearance it may appear to have a gray-ish cast, but that quickly dissipates after being blended into skin. I do not use this as a moisturizer, but instead use my Cera Ve a few minute before applying and allow that to absorb before applying this. This evens my skin tone out perfectly, although I do need to use a little concealer under my dark circles.<br /><br />To my fourth point above, I do have oily skin, and this product is designed to control oil. I set it with Maybelline Shine Free loose powder and have noticed a substantial decrease in the oiliness and shine of my skin.<br /><br />Now, onto my biggest rave of this product. In addition to leaving my skin flawless and beautiful while I'm wearing it, my skin is actually improving after I take it off! I started noticing this effect after about 2 weeks of using the product almost daily. I did not anticipate this effect; indeed, it is what inspired me to write this review. The expression lines on my forehead are actually noticeably diminished, my pores appear tighter, and my skin is baby soft and smooth. Now, I do use Retin A micro and I exfoliate a few times a week with a polishing brush, but I have never noticed this kind of effect with any other cosmetic product. I have an overall glow and any little marks that I had due to old acne are disappearing too. I attribute that to the whitening agent in this and the face that there are so many natural ingredients.<br /><br />A little side note-BB cream was actually developed to help plastic surgery patients heal post-opt. It allowed them to blend their scars away while healing. That should tell you something.<br /><br />Sorry for the long review, but I felt it was important to point out that this product can and does work miracles for the right kind of skin type and tone. If you have extremely dry skin, this may not work for you. Skin 79 offers different formulas that are designed for different skin types; you can check their website for more detailed information. If you have olive or tan skin, or plan to use tanning beds/go out in the sun/spray tan, this is not the right thing for you. Also, if you are not diligent about your skin and do not wash it off at night, I do not think you would get the same effects I have. It really is a cosmetic and needs to be applied to clean skin in the morning and removed at night. I suspect that it would be easy to think of this as a lotion and not bother washing it off.<br /><br />Overall, I truly love this product and can't wait to explore other Skin 79 products. I honestly hope they never bring this to market in the US because it seems like whenever a cult product overseas comes to the US they have to change their formulas and they end up nothing like the original (I am thinking of Ellnet hairspray as one horrible example). I will continue to order for years to come, although I don't anticipate having to do it often since you get such a generous amount in this lovely little package!ou. Also, if you are not diligent about your skin and do not wash it off at night, I do not think you would get the same effects I have. It really is a cosmetic and needs to be applied to clean skin in the morning and removed at night. I suspect that it would be easy to think of this as a lotion and not bother washing it off.<br /><br />Overall, I truly love this product and can't wait to explore other Skin 79 products. I honestly hope they never bring this to market in the US because it seems like whenever a cult product overseas comes to the US they have to change their formulas and they end up nothing like the original (I am thinking of Ellnet hairspray as one horrible example). I will continue to order for years to come, although I don't anticipate having to do it often since you get such a generous amount in this lovely little package!

It looked amazing, and even without powder, it dried to a natural matte finish.<br /><br />But... I happened to be one of the few who had a horrid reaction to it. I've been using this every day for about a week, and began noticing breakouts only a day or two into wearing it. This gave me any and every kind of breakout imaginable in places on my face I never get pimples or blackheads.<br /><br />All in all, I cant give this product a negative review, because I really did like it. I would use this with caution, though. It is known to cause breakouts in a small percentage of users. I just really didn't want to be among them.

I find that I need to use a very small amount to cover my face (maybe a half-pump total?). I have not noticed any change in my complexion in terms of acne (no different than my skin was before using this product) and have been very pleased.<br /><br />As the title says, I use this BB Cream under my bare minerals matte foundation. After washing my face, if my skin is especially shiny, I apply Murad \\"Oil-Control Mattifier SPF 15,\\" although if I don't need to, I skip this step (because that stuff is wonderful but expensive!). After that dries, I pump a pea-sized drop of BB Cream to my finger tips and pat it on my face (my friends make fun of me because it just looks like I'm slapping myself in the mirror). After the BB Cream (which is SPF 25, thank god!), if I need to conceal any really dark spots, I use MAKE UP FOREVER \\"Professional Full Cover.\\" Then, on goes my Bare Minerals Matte Foundation, and although my skin looks great at this stage, I add on the Bare Minerals Mineral Veil after this to set my foundation for the day.<br /><br />With the routine I mentioned above, I've gone down to using oil-absorbing sheets maybe once a day on my face, a great improvement over my former 3-4 times a day.<br /><br />NOTE: I have no idea how other reviewers are going through their bottles so quickly, unless perhaps they're piling this cream onto their skin multiple times a day. This product is best in SMALL amounts. I don't need to apply it more than once in a day. The 40g bottle should last me through the end of the year.<br /><br />I would recommend buying a sample kit of BB Creams, the Skin79 mini set of 4 for example, is worth it. I felt much more confident in which formula to pick after doing so.<br /><br />Overall, this product works wonders for me and has become a part of my daily skin care routine.<br /><br />If it helps, I ordered from pinkgelee, and their products are legitimate (they ship pretty quickly, too!).BB Creams, the Skin79 mini set of 4 for example, is worth it.   462. I thought I would put in my two cents on this topic as a 50+ woman with freckles and other sun damage. Have never used foundation because of its heavy feel and artificial appearance. I decided to try the pink label Super+ Beblesh... for a more finished look.<br /><br />I like it, but have experimented with the best method for applying. One helpful review suggested patting it on instead of rubbing in. I have found I like the opposite approach - rubbing into my face; the other way resulted in a pallid effect. So I rub in a small amount with both hands and then blot with a tissue. It gives good coverage and an even tone without looking make-up-y. And it lasts all day! I am stunned in the evening when I wash my face at the amount I find on my washcloth.<br /><br />As for the condition of my skin, I think the claims are valid - my skin looks better and feels better since I've been using it - will look at the gold label to see what that's about. Would definitely buy the pink label again!

I also have combination skin, so it can be dry at the worst times, but it will get oily and melt my makeup off before the day is done. I've tried all sorts of primers, nothing really worked as well as I'd hoped.<br /><br />I can use this alone if I'm not looking for a lot of coverup or don't feel like wearing make up that day. Usually though, I moisturize first and let that absorb, then I use this over my entire face. I follow it up with a little MAC Select cover up mixed with fix+ so its just a light application, over my problem areas just for a little added coverage. I had pimples all over my forehead, so I recently switched back to my old BB cream (Holika Holika--I'd stopped using it because I thought it made my face look too pale, but now I think I'm getting used to it. Plus, the paleness seems to fade as the day goes on.). The pimples are now going away after switching back, so that makes me think maybe this SKIN79 BB cream isn't right for my skin.

  491. I made the rookie mistake of applying it topically before but since I started applying it all over my face and adding a little bit of extra on the problem areas, it really just make the imperfections so less noticeable.   492. This BB cream is the best I've tried as far as texture and coverage without feeling heavy, and believe me when I say I've tried A LOT of BB creams. Barely any scent at all either, which I love. It feels like I have nothing on my face, which is exactly the feel I'm going for. My skin is super oily with big pores in the t-zone and this is fantastic in covering those imperfections and in keeping the shine at bay. Like I've said, I have tried many other BB creams, even ones made for oily skin, but nothing has made my skin feel good like this one. BB creams always make me shine after just 30 minutes of having it on. Not this one, so it's a great choice for oily skin. One problem though - the shade is too pale. I'm not dark skinned at all. I'm actually Asian with light/medium skin tone. However, this makes me look very pale wearing it, like I haven't seen the sun in forever. I really wish they made one a shade darker, and it would be a perfect product!
  493. So when I first heard about BB Creams, they sounded exactly like what I needed. I tried a few washed-down American BB creams and liked the moisturizer and sunscreen, but the coverage was just not enough for daily wear. So then I tried Skin79's BB cream. I figured I could use it on my &#34;light&#34; makeup days and wear my typical foundation on the regular days. After using it, I haven't even touched my traditional foundations again. It makes my skin look BEAUTIFUL. It's not a thick coverage - but that's OK for me because it looks so natural.<br /><br />I am Caucasian and used to wear Neautrogena's foundation (in 40) and this stuff blends in a matches my skin perfectly. I blend it in with a beauty sponge and it lasts all day. Also, I have Kerotosis Pilaris and after 3 months of this BB cream - my KP flares have reduced dramatically!<br /><br />Great, natural looking makeup? Clear skin? In one?! I'm sold. I won't even use another product on my face.
  494. I've used both Missha and Skin79, and I thought I'd wait until I finished both products to write my review. Here's my quick and dirty:<br /><br />Missha - Good coverage. Odd smell. Made my skin look dewy. Better SPF level. Somewhat melted off my face by the end of the day. Good dispenser.<br /><br />Skin79 - Good coverage. Nice smell. My skin looked more matte after applying. Okay SPF. Lasted a little longer than Missha. Hate the dispenser.<br /><br />Now that I've done both, I'm going back to Missha.<br /><br />I like that it has a higher SPF, and the Skin79 dispenser has either broken, or its close to being empty. I hate that I can't be for certain, by the weight it still feels like there is product left in the container, and the frugal in me hates throwing it away without checking to make sure its empty. I'll probably break it open to make sure I can use the rest of it. The Missha dispenser was also easier to regulate how much product I wanted to dispense, I think I went through the Skin79 bottle much faster because of the weird bottle.<br /><br />All in all, I really like using a *real* BB Cream. My skin looks really nice, no wrinkles, and I rarely break out. I wear it under loose powder, which helps set the product and make it last longer throughout the day. Both BB Creams look weird when you first put it on, but eventually blends to your skin tone. I have slightly yellow undertones to my skin, even though I'm caucasian, and this looks natural once its blended.
  495. I can't believe I wasted so much money on American BB creams! The coverage is medium but it's still really lightweight. So far no breakouts. My face still gets oily but not as bad and much later in the day; but my pores definitely look smaller and my skin smoother. I have gotten several comments from different people about how great my skin looks and that is all I really want.
  496. I love BB cream, but only skin79 brand. Other BB creams don't work as good. The only cons are, you can't tell how much is left in the bottle so keep a back up on hand, and depending on where you buy from shipping can take a long time.
  497. First of all, just a warning that this review will be lengthy, but it comes from the heart and speaks the truth on my part, and this is the kind of review I was looking for before purchasing this product because I hate purchasing new, expensive make up that I take a risk on and then hate and never use again, so hopefully it helps you! ;) If it's too long for you, just know that I LOVE it and that's all you need to know -- you won't be disappointed. :) But if you want more details, read further!<br /><br />I just want everyone to take heed: *this bb cream is NOTHING like American bb creams -- and I mean that in the best possible way ever*, so *do not* judge Korean bb creams off of American ones. American bb creams are more like a tinted moisturizer, while Korean bb creams are a magical make up wonder.<br /><br />To give you a little background, I am a 22-year-old, my skin is combination, I suffer from moderate acne especially in my T zone and especially when I am hormonal. My skin is light, and depending on how much sun I've gotten can range from an ivory to a light nude color. I have freckles. I have dark under eye circles and some scars on my skin from past acne. I wear make up almost every day that I have to socially interact with the world (well, maybe not every day, because a girl's gotta let her skin breathe and get's a little lazy...) even if it's just foundation of some type and mascara, and I always hope my makeup lasts all day, with anywhere from working at my internship at a desk job rubbing my eyes and squeezing my head from stress or working outside in my yard or going for a walk with my dog later in the day.<br /><br />I have *always* worn foundation since I started wearing makeup around 8th grade. I really wanted it to even out my tone and cover blemishes. One problem that I have with foundation is that it is SO thick and it easily transfers to other things. It always looks so amazing when you first put it on, but wait a few hours, do a few things, and you'll notice considerable deterioration of the look of your make up. I've tried so many different kinds, from expensive Clinique to cheap E.L.F. For those of you who know my tale of woe, you know what I'm talking about. For those of you who don't, foundation easily covers up my freckles, and the second you put your hand on your face and touch a doorknob or keyboard later in the day, there's a good chance that some of your makeup will transfer to your hands and other things. For good coverage, the amount of foundation you'll need (and keep needing, if you need to keep applying it throughout the day to cover imperfections) can be massive. I never considered that there would be something that works like a foundation but doesn't cause all those other problems. That sounded too good to be true. :)<br /><br />To give you a little background on how I came across this product, I'll tell you a quick story. I actually was on the interstate on my way to work when my car broke down. I was horrified, having to get my car towed standing in dress clothes and heels looking like a fool as everyone passed me. I thought it was the worst day ever. But when I got into the car with the man who towed my car, his wife was waiting in the truck, too. She was from South Korea and was the sweetest thing ever and instantly made my day brighter. I told her that I was a big fan of South Korea's fashion scene, and she rummaged in her purse and gave me a little tube of make up. She told me everyone in South Korea loves bb cream (authentic Korean, not American, bb cream) and swears by it. The kind of bb cream was Charm Cell and it looked goofy but I thanked her regardless. It was nice.<br /><br />The next day, I got up and took a peek at it, not sure if I should put anything on my face from a stranger. I opened it and it was sealed, and then I looked up online more information about the product. My jaw dropped when I saw it retailed to 70 DOLLARS for a small tube! I tried it out for the next weekand fell in love. I'll tell you my revelations on why below, so keep reading. I didn't end up wanting to spend 70 dollars for a small tube, so I researched other top brands, and Skin79 was one of them. I'm so happy I went down this route.<br /><br />First of all, I have to say that my skin is BETTER than it ever has been before after using Skin79's Hot Pink bb cream. I've never actually worn make up that I believe improves my complexion, allows me to have my *natural* skin but still covers blemishes, and feels light weight and fresh. I purposely waited A MONTH to write this review so that I didn't just rant or rave after a day, or even a week after trying this product. You have to give it a little time, too to see any long term results, whether good or bad for you.<br /><br />Some of the major things I've noticed: My acne has decreased. My skin tone has evened (not as much of a drastic difference between a face with no make up vs. a face with make up). my make up breathes better and isn't completely obvious that I'm wearing it on my face (you know, the whole \\"it makes you look more professional and naturally pretty instead of obviously fake pancake face\\"). You can still see my freckles (depending on whether you're proud to don those or not, and if not, use a little of your foundation on top to cover them, this bb cream works great as a primer :)) It blends PERFECTLY into my face. It smells nice and doesn't leave residue everywhere. It LASTS for almost the whole day and looks great!<br /><br />A few tips: don't just pump a large amount into your hand and rub your face. Start small and use a small amount. There's a certain technique to putting it on that you can read about online (I hope to post a review/tutorial soon to my own website, so I'll update this review when I do). Just dab small dots all over your face and then *pat* it into your skin, don't rub. Apply two to three applications depending on how much coverage you want.<br /><br />A lot of people mention a greyish tone when it first goes on, but I don't find this with mine. I feel like if you put on just enough and not too much, you won't run into that problem.<br /><br />On days when I want a bit more coverage and to look more flawless on my face (say, for a special occasion) I take my regular foundation (I use E.L.F. liquid foundation, that's amazing too, you should check it out) and just apply a little bit around my under eye circles and around my mouth and jawline. It blends in PERFECTLY with the bb cream and I find it sets better with the BB cream acting as a primer as well (assuming you give the bb cream a few minutes to dry before you apply the foundation). I also use a bronzer or matting powder to set the bb cream and I find this makes it stay even better.<br /><br />All in all, I COMPLETELY recommend this. I'm your average girl who tried this after a chance encounter and a lot of reading of reviews online, and I am telling you that I'm impressed. I would hope this product would work as well for all of you, but realistically I know that not all make up is created equal for each person. However, if any of my traits sound like you, try this, try this, try this. It's totally worth it. And if you're too scared to invest in a big bottle, Amazon does sell sampler packs so you can purchase a small amount first (those small samples will last you almost a week if you ration correctly!).<br /><br />Sorry for the long review -- but for those nervous Nellies out there like me, I hope it helped you. ;) Once again, check back soon and I'll hopefully have a link up to my website with further information and before/after pictures for you to look at. :)and fell in love. I'll tell you my revelations on why below, so keep reading. I didn't end up wanting to spend 70 dollars for a small tube, so I researched other top brands, and Skin79 was one of them. However, if any of my traits sound like you, try this, try this, try this. It's totally worth it. And if you're too scared to invest in a big bottle, Amazon does sell sampler packs so you can purchase a small amount first (those small samples will last you almost a week if you ration correctly!).<br /><br />Sorry for the long review -- but for those nervous Nellies out there like me, I hope it helped you. ;) Once again, check back soon and I'll hopefully have a link up to my website with further information and before/after pictures for you to look at. :)
  498. Love the concealing effect - it really whitens my olive skin (I'm Asian) but doesn't make me look too pale. The best part is it doesn't get oily even when it's really hot outside so it stays all day for me. Love it and def coming back for it!
  499. Bought this after trying the new Garnier BB and liking it. I am caucasian and find the Garnier a MUCH nicer color, although it is a little stickier than this one once it's dry. The SKIN79 cream is good, it's just that I don't understand why they have to make it a grey color that is hard to blend! (Why not beige??? People are beige, not grey - unless they're dead!) Yes, I know you can blend it and blend it, but by the time it's \\"blended\\" (i.e., not looking greyish anymore), it is very sheer as well which is sometimes not desired. So, if your skin has a grey undertone, I highly recommend this cream. If you are beige, not so much. :D

  504. This is the third Asian BB cream I have tried. The first two are Lioele's Triple the Solution and Beyond the Solution... both of those are amazing with Beyond the Solution being my favorite. The SKIN79 BB cream is just ok to me. Coverage is similar to that of a tinted moisturizer, but with slightly more coverage. On first application I could tell it wouldn't provide as much coverage as the Lioele ones I've tried. It felt greasy on my face and it seemed like it never set. I put on powder to counteract this and it looked great. However, after a few hours my face looks like a grease ball and every pore on my face is highlighted. Not a fan at all. Also, while the package is pretty and the pump is convenient (when it works) it is too bulky. My pump has stopped working and will only dispense product after I've pumped it two or three times. Not buying this again and I will stick with my Lioele BB creams which provide better coverage and have superior packaging.
  505. I've tried other BB creams and was never really satisfied. They are really just tinted moisturizers. This was totally different. It covers great. I have redness on my cheeks and it covers without needing concealer. It really does seem to brighten my complexion too. I really love it! I do use a primer underneath. I noticed that when I don't, I seem to get shiny pretty quickly, but the primer stops that from happening. This product is my new best friend!
  506. I've been using this for weeks now and it's hands down the best BB Cream. I've tried many, but this one is really amazing. It's a great value but also is great for your skin. I noticed a difference right away when I started using it. Highly recommended!!
  507. I'm 23 years old, have a ton of freckles with pretty oily skin that is also very break-out prone. I was skeptical of BB creams at first and did a ton of research before actually buying one and found that the REAL BB creams (originally from Korea) were the way to go and man, am I glad I did. The ones on the American market are pretty sub-par compared to the ones over there (per users that have tried both). I've heard a lot of bad things about this particular BB cream being \\"too grey\\", and I can see where that comes from. You only need about half a pump to completely cover your face (mine, at least) and using any more than that can make you look very washed out. I bought my cream in February and still use it everyday. All in all:<br />-light, but very full coverage<br />-covers over any uneven skin tones<br />-did NOT cause breakouts<br />-inexpensive<br />-lasts a long time<br />Hope this works out for you as well as it has for me!
  508. This is a BB cream that is whitening which I'm not a big fan of and the reason I will be tossing this cream. It feels thick and heavy when you apply it, also makes your skin shiny. Overall, it hydrates fine but there are better options out there.
  509. This is the first BB cream I have tried and it does what it says. I have used it for exactly two months now and I can say my acne has gotten better. I like the coverage as well. The reason I give four stars is because I am unsure if it is related to recent abnormal menstrul cycles. I have had a normal cycle almost to the hour for many years now. The month I started using this product I was late for my period by a week and the next month I was four days late. I also have never had a problem getting pregnant and since using this product we have been trying for another child and regardless of what we do we can't get pregnant. I am trying to look for ingredients so my pharmacist can look at them to make sure. It might just be a very very very weird coincidence but I am going to postpone using this product for two months And if my cycles normalize and I get pregnant quickly then I will stop using this product. If it is just a weird coincidence then I would love to use this for life.<br />UPDATE:<br />So I stopped using this during my last menstrual period and sure enough my period is back on track. I mentioned this to my health care provider and she also believes this is the culprit. She named a \\"natural\\" ingredient that can be used for whitening that messes up Estrogen levels. I have had discharge from my nipples for months now and it finally seems as though it is drying up. My PCP also said this happens when they give Depo - so definitely not what you want when trying to conceive......or ever for that matter. This product is obviously no regulated and that is fine, but know what you're putting on your body people.
  510. I have been a makeup artist for 14+ years and have used every product/brand out there. I was fascinated with the hype behind these Asian BB creams. I was very pleased with the consistency of this product, it has great coverage and feels a bit tacky. That is why it goes on better by dabbing rather then applying like a moisturizer.<br />Although the color may seem light at first, it does transition to your skin color quite a bit. And if it does not completely match because you have darker skin I reccomend a bronzing powder.<br />My skin felt super soft and looked flawless! I also have noticed a difference in skins texture and appearance. Not drastically, but a much bigger difference to any other BB cream or moisturizer I have ever used. I have even used it to cover and reduce the appearance of a scar on my stomach. So far I have been very pleased, and for the price everyone should at least try this!
  511. Since I've gotten middle aged I have been searching for a new makeup that won't look heavy and highlight wrinkles. I am now the owner of a large drawer full of foundations, tinted moisturizers, and a couple of BB creams that didn't quite do it for me. At my age foundations look like dried up pancake batter and tinted moisturizers aren't quite enough. I think this BB cream is the one.<br /><br />I use this over most of my face, especially the T zone where I tend to be a little redder. When you first put it on it's kind of startling because it's so gray, but somehow it quickly changes color and blends right it. If I have any discolored areas I've been tapping a little foundation there for additional coverage. After a couple of months of using it my skin seems to have improved to the point I haven't even been using the foundation. The cream has a different texture which I don't have words to describe, kind of like lotion without being greasy. It does feel different on my skin, kind of wet, not oily. I use a light dusting of powder over it or it would be a little shiny for me. I really think my pores seem tighter and my skin seems healthier.

  515. I range in skintone between NC25-NC30. It does actually settle more into your skintone as time passes, but if you are yellow toned and darker, it will read like a pale greyish pink on your skin if you do not use something on top. I actually do like this cream and will continue to use it until I finish the bottle. But if I were to find another BB cream with a better skintone match but similar finish, which I can, since there are dozens, I will liekly not buy this again. But I did like the finish. It is rather thick textured but does not feel thick on skin and my skin actually looks very smooth and eventoned. It covered large pores and gave a glowy finish even without the other illuminators. If you are on the cool/pinked toned side or VERY PALE yellow and range 25 and under on the MAC shade range you can use this fine. Discourage anyone else darker to purchase this unless you want to use as a primer/sunscreen under your regular makeup which you can certainly do. It does not pill or have a rough texture.

I also have yellow undertones with some pink. My skin type is &#34;Angry&#34; and oily -- most makeup / skin care products are vetoed via breakouts (good o'll fashion zits + cystic), burning sensations, giant blackheads, redness, etc. ad nauseum.<br /><br />The first day I tried this product my husband was in the room and I only applied it to one side of my face then asked which side had makeup. He said he couldn't tell (which was a very nice white lie I think), but added that the right-side (BB side) was less red than the left -- score! Plus, the BB felt like a nice, soft lotion, not at all like makeup or US brand BBs.<br /><br />The next day wasn't so great. I used two pumps of the BB and got a face full of shinny grey. Regardless, the product felt great on my angry skin so I left it on.<br /><br />Day three I used three pumps (more is always better, right?) and almost drowned myself. I covered my face, neck, chest, shoulders, and hands (just for good measure, this stuff does feel amazing on). I looked like, and felt like, Casper the friendly ghost and resolved to figure out what I was doing wrong.<br /><br />After watching too many YouTube videos I figured out a few tricks:<br />1. Less is more<br />2. Put a pump on the back of your hand and smudge it a little before applying to your face<br />2. RUB RUB RUB (counter intuitive for a foundation-like product, but necessary)<br />3. Wait a few minutes to let the BB match your tone<br />4. If you still want some more coverage / correct color match, use a powder<br /><br />The coverage isn't as dense as a foundation but it still conceals uneven tones nicely. It really looks like no makeup and feels nice on (even in 85% humidity weather).ation but it still conceals uneven tones nicely. It really looks like no makeup and feels nice on (even in 85% humidity weather).

I personally do not like to wear too much foundation because I have oil skin---and by the end of the day, only bits of foundation are left making my face look blotchy and very uneven. Upon application the cream does have a slightly grey cast to it, but just wait a couple minutes and you are left with a dewy even-toned complection. I finished off the look with a light dusting of blush and was amazed. There is something about the texture and consistency of this product that is completely different than any other type of foundation I have ever used. The product lasted through out the day and didn't cause any breakout issues with my skin over time. Bon voyage to foundation for me!
  570. This stuff is absolutely amazing. I got it nearly 9 months ago and it finally ran out sadly. I'm not sure if it really whitened my skin, but it was always super nice to apply and to wear every day. The added bonus of SPF was great too!
  571. I received this product about four weeks after I ordered it. Since I'm in Canada, it was good enough shipping time though I wish sellers would remove or lower the shipping fee for international transactions. BTW, I bought mine from Pink Gelee, it was the cheapest seller that sold to Canada and they were very courteous too (they give you a note of appreciation at your package). Anyways, I discovered BB creams online. Considering the reviews I saw, Skin79 was (and is still) one of the most highly sought BB creams due to its 'effectiveness' and price. I bought it here in Amazon since it has a reasonable price. I've seen reviews saying that it was concealer, acne fighter, moisturizer, sunscreen, etc. etc. all in the same product. Others claimed it cleared acne and others said it was the worst BB cream they've tried.<br /><br />First of all, I am My friends told me that my acne were getting unnoticeable. For the first time in my life, a product worked in fighting this. There were times when people asked if I was wearing makeup (people are divided if it's a cosmetic or not) so I just said no, maybe this is because I was too sleepy and applied it incorrectly. A week ago, our school walked for three hours for a cancer research charity event and the next day, we went to church, also by walking. I noticed that I didn't get a sunburn nor a tan (which is a good thing for me and I got sunburns in the same event last year and the year before last year). I was convinced that it was the BB cream that did this. The BB cream was kinda greasy at first but it loses the greasiness as you spread it out even more. It doesn't cover all blemishes and scars but it will cover mostly some of them. Wrinkles are another issue. It claims to remove wrinkles but mine didn't. However, it did minimize it.<br /><br />The things I don't like however are I have to remove it everyday (I use Pond's Cold Cream Cleanser), it seems like it's sometimes causing acne (or it might not, probably its my sleeping pattern and nutrition), it doesn't fights other skin problems (like wrinkles, moles, and scars), it's too hard to get off your hands (since I use my hands to apply it on my face), sweating can make them disappear, and they can get into your clothes and hair.<br /><br />I've been using this for only a month, and I still don't know if it benefits me. If this BB cream will soon either change (fight/benefit) blemishes, acne, and acne scars, I will update this review. As for now, thank you Skin79 and the sellers for making this product available to people not in Korea and I will definitely try other Skin79 products.

  582. I must say, after days of researching different BB creams and watching every video review on the planet, I am pleased that I picked this one. It is truly a fantastic product. I have been using it for about two months and I am about to purchase my second bottle. I still have about half of my original bottle left, but I want to have another on reserve before my other one runs out.<br /><br />I originally set out to buy the Smashbox BB cream after hearing so much hype on it. Of course that opened my eyes to the dozens of different BB creams offered, and of course I wanted to choose the best one. I took several factors into consideration: price, ingredient/product quality, and of course how it looks. The Skin79 BB cream is a third of the price of the Smashbox, and it works better than more expensive foundations I have used over the years.<br /><br />I am Caucasian with a light tan/olive complexion that tends to be oily in my t-zone. The cream goes on pale, but after a few minutes it oxidizes to my skin tone. A dime or nickel sized amount is all it takes, and I spread it around with my fingers. I have used foundation brushes, but I prefer using my hands as I think my skin always looks cakey after using a brush. After it oxidizes it is still about a shade lighter than my skin tone, but I finish it with a slightly darker powder and the difference is hardly noticeable. And of course in the winter when my skin is more pale, I think there will be no difference at all.<br /><br />I don't think this BB cream does much for oil control, but then again I was not expecting it to miraculously halt my skin's natural processes. I simply blot my face every 4 hours or so, and I am all set. The BB cream stays looking flawless all day. It evens out my skin tone, and it moisturizes decently. I will sometimes put a couple dots of moisturizer on trouble areas before applying BB cream, but it is usually not necessary. Also, some people use it as a primer under foundation, but even on my worstskin days the BB cream is ample coverage. It practically makes me glow!<br /><br />I seriously love this stuff. It is yet another gem that Korea has shared with the world.

  631. I'm new to BB cream but this has definitely improved the texture of my skin compared to just using moisturizer. I've always stayed away from other brands because I'm Filipino and have a lot of yellow in my skintone so I have a hard time matching makeup products. This one advertises a &#34;whitening&#34; agent which is popular amongst pale skinned Asians. Still, the creme itself comes out a muddy-clay color and takes a while to blend into my skin. I like all the nutrients because it has drastically improved my skin, but after 3 months it hasn't done anything to keep my oily skin under control. But I got this for a steal so it was definitely worth trying, maybe I'll explore their other products to see if they have anything to specifically target my oily skin.

  635. I've never really used foundation or anything like that in the past so I decided to buy this after seeing so many great reviews.<br /><br />I am a medium-light, combo/oily skinned, Asian teenage female. The cream is mostly suited for light light medium. (A few shades lighter than me...but I still use it.)<br /><br />Pros:<br />- Controls oil..for a while (Coming from a person with really oily skin by the end of the day!)<br />- No one will notice that you are wearing anything on your face<br />- Not cakey AT ALL unlike most foundations (This is one main reason why I like it so much)<br />- SPF!!!<br />- Smooth texture on skin<br />- Consistency may be thick at first, but it spreads on very lightly<br />- Coverage is not too light, not too heavy (Perfect for me because I have light acne scars)<br />- Smells cute (Doesn't smell like chemicals and stuff)<br />- Didn't clog pores (Or at least I don't think it did!)<br />- Anti-wrinkle properties (I don't know about this yet because I'm only 17.)<br />- Primer<br />- Evens out my skintone<br />- Easy to use container<br /><br />Cons:<br />- Only one shade (Medium skinned people, don't use this...you may need to apply another darker powder foundation above it)<br />- Color tends to fade away (After 5 hours or so, the cream just matches in with my regular skin color)<br />- Oil control is alright (I start oiling after 2 hours or so... which is reasonable...because my skin is stubborn. I still have to use blotting sheets though.)<br />- MAY clog some of larger pores so BE SURE YOU WASH THAT STUFF OFF COMPLETELY!!! (Use those clarisonic cleansers or similar)<br />- It has parabens... and some other ingredients that are a bit ~questionable~ (I don't know how I feel about this...)<br />- If applied on dry skin (like right after you wash your face), it may look a bit weird... so moisturize before you apply it<br />- Don't know how much I have left because the container isn't clear<br /><br /> *** Also, BEWARE of fakes being sold on here or anywhere else!!! I bought mine from NEVERPRICE, and it is AUTHENTIC! ***
  636. I am a mid-twenties Caucasian F with combination skin. Have had issues with adult-onset acne and have been battling it for a few years. Now that I feel like I have it reasonably under control, I set out to find an alternative to foundation, as I felt sure use of heavy make-ups (no matter the brand) was contributing to my skin issues.<br /><br />All around, this BB cream is great. I do agree with other reviewers who say it has too much of a &#34;gray&#34; tone to it. Even once you pat it on and blend it, it still carries a hint of a gray. Maybe for a naturally darker-complected person it would be perfect. Otherwise, it really does work to even skin tone and give your complexion a healthy, dewy look. Not only is the cream itself smooth and even, it also seems to help smooth and even out your natural skin during the day while you wear it. When I rinse it off with warm water at night, I notice my skin is moisturized and dark spots have lightened.<br /><br />Pros:<br />- I can sleep in it without breaking out<br />- It doesn't look cakey and unnatural in sunlight<br />- I prefer it infinitely to foundation<br />- Seems to improve my skin rather than harm it<br />- A very small amount goes a looonggg way<br />- Price is great<br /><br />Cons:<br />- Grayish tone<br />- Slightly greasy to the touch (but can be set with powder easily)<br />- Doesn't stay put maybe as well as I'd hoped

  667. In brief:<br /><br />If you have a<br /> fair to medium complexion with yellow undertones<br /> not too many imperfections (this is not a concealer)<br /> NOT sensitive skin<br />and don't care about parabens and such get this. It's a value.<br /><br />But, on to my review. I agree with most 5 star reviews written here. I used it avidly for a month and here is what I found:<br /> It's a dream to put on<br /> Actually blends to match your tone within reasonable limits (it is slightly grayish on me so I tend to put small amounts on so that it can oxidize properly)<br /> For being oily when it goes on, it actually controls oil pretty well (your face won't have a perfect matte finish all day but you won't be extremely shiny either).<br /> It stays on<br /> It is really convenient<br /> It has 15 natural ingredients!!!!!!<br /><br />But it has some problems, so I decided to give up using it:<br /><br /> It feels too oily at first (and if you slap on too much before running out the door you will feel gross for a couple of hours)<br /> I had some problems with it after a couple of uses and my face completely dried up. I used it on top of Clinique moisture surge and it worked better. (I have combination towards oily skin)<br /> Because of the oily consistency I noticed I occasionally get pimples on hot days (It doesn't let your face breath so go figure)<br /> It contains about 40 un-natural products including Triclosan, parabens and BHT<br /> It smells- i.e. it contains perfume-it's really girly and I guess it could be pleasant, I just don't like it because I feel cheap wearing it (think Victoria's Secret type vanilla-y smell or Bath and Body Works- if you smell like that you'll like this)<br /> I don't see a considerable improvement in my skin (well, since I had to peel off the dead skin after it dried my face, I had soft skin for 2 weeks, but again, indirectly)<br /><br />Now, obviously, I was not expecting an all natural, vegan friendly, packaged in 100% recycled plastic product. I placed it at overpriced drug store level. The main issue I have with it is that I started reading the ingredients list when I got it, and by being so excited I saw so many natural extracts, I just went ahead and tried it. You can imagine how my excitement disappeared when I reread that list a few days later to figure out what was causing my skin to freak out. So, I hate to break it to you but all the \\"traditional korean ingredients\\" are pure gimmick.<br /><br />Why 3 stars? Because I tried all of the western and most of the Korean more expensive BB creams and this one does its job the best: best coverage without looking like foundation.

  675. After hearing about how much better Korean BB Creams were than Western ones, I decided I needed a Skin79 BB. I like to read reviews before I buy any product, online or not, and I was bummed to learn that a lot of people had come across fake BB Creams that made them break out. I dedicated weeks to watching Youtube video and reading about how to tell the difference between the real and fake bottles/packaging. I wasn't savvy enough (or at all) in Korean to navigate their official site, so I turned to Amazon and eBay.<br /><br />Some reviews for Pink Gelee's product say theirs were fake, but I emailed the shop owner with my concerns, placed the order, and took a leap of faith. A week later, it was in my mailbox and I was swatching it on my hand and slathering on my face. The consistency is awesome and the coverage is amazing. It's initially not as grey as everyone makes it out to be, but it fades to match your skin tone (for lighter skinned individuals) in no time. I ran the package through every test I could think of, just waiting for a slip up from the manufacturer. Waiting for it to be fake: Color of the box, perforated side, spelling mistakes, font size/boldness, pump style, how easily the letters scratch off, barcode placement, &#34;void&#34;/seal of quality sticker: it all passed. I couldn't believe it. If you're reading these reviews because you're looking for the real deal, this is it.<br /><br />The seller was also nice enough to include samples of Heynature BB Black Diamond Moist Tightening Blemish Base and Aqua Brightening Gel. I haven't tried either of them out yet, but I was happy they were included.<br /><br />Bottom line: I am head over heels in love with this BB Cream and will absolutely be back here to repurchase when this bottle runs out.

  687. I've used mineral powder foundation for many years but at age 60 wanted something that wouldn't settle in my fine lines and creases after a few hours. I have combination normal/oily skin, still prone to occasional blemishes, and quite oily in the humid summer months.<br /><br />I watched a you-tube video, but the first time I used a bit too much and didn't let it dry between layers. It became visible in my creases after a few hours.<br /><br />The next time I used slightly less than a pea-sized amount, dotted it on & lightly spread it. I let that dry and applied again, using even less. I found that by very lightly pressing it into my skin with my hands or a fine, dry makeup sponge it melted right into my skin. When completely dry, I could see it evened out my color and covered large pores on my nose. Then I brushed on a bit of Everyday Minerals Finishing Dust to set it. Wonderful results! No glow but not perfectly matte either. BTW I also used Neutrogena Naturals Multivitamin Nourishing Moisturizer underneath it all - letting that dry before I started and the BB went on smoother.<br /><br />I've worn it when temps were in the 80's and humid and am delighted that my shiny break-through (normally happens within a couple of hours) never did occur. Although it felt a bit oily when first applied, after it completely dried it was fine. And I like the softer look on my aging skin better than the dry look I got from mineral makeup.<br /><br />My complexion is fair with neutral undertones and my natural hair color is/was medium auburn. I found this BB cream suits my coloring well, without adding any pink tones. I love that it covers so well without looking like I'm wearing any makeup. I highly recommend this it!
